pinyin: Zi3 jin1 shan1 Tian1 wen2 tai2

sentences.english: The Observatory explained that the average wind speed in Victoria Harbour did not reach storm force level.
sentences.chinese: 天文臺解釋，是維港港內普遍風速未達烈風程度。

sentences.english: In comparison, the Earth orbits at just 1 AU.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，地球軌道只是一個天文單位。

sentences.english: There's an observatory on Mt. Zijin.
sentences.chinese: 這南京紫金山上就有一座天文臺。

sentences.english: “The cost would be a ridiculous figure,” he says.
sentences.chinese: “其花費將是一個天文數字，”他說。

sentences.english: English abbreviations HEAO , namely, high-energy observatory.
sentences.chinese: 英文縮寫HEAO，即“高能天文臺”。

sentences.english: The demand from the mainland alone is going to be astronomical.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅來自大陸的需求就是一個天文數字。

sentences.english: Neither Maya tradition nor modern astronomy supports a belief in any such beam.
sentences.chinese: 無論是瑪雅傳統還是現代天文學都不支持這種觀點。

sentences.english: It refers to special astronomic events that will happen in 2012.
sentences.chinese: 它指向將在2012年發生的一次特殊天文事件。

sentences.english: In this papert the classification and method of the digital image compression technique as well as its application to astronomy are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 概述了數字圖像壓縮技術在天文領域應用的必要性。

sentences.english: The big budgets astronomy projects bring can provide funds for education.
sentences.chinese: 天文學項目帶來的龐大預算可以爲教育提供資金。

sentences.english: The dates are, in fact, astronomical, astrological and astrotheological.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，這個日期是天文學，占星術和星相學。

sentences.english: There’s a difference between a telescope builder and an astronomer, of course.
sentences.chinese: 當然，望遠鏡的製造者和天文學家是有所不同的。

sentences.english: Astronomers say the newly-found planet lies in the middle of what's referred to as the habitable or Goldilocks zone.
sentences.chinese: 天文學家說這顆新星處在稱爲可居住區的中間。

sentences.english: " central time, the Vanderbilt Dyer Observatory's Alvey said.
sentences.chinese: 中央標準時間，範德比爾特戴爾天文臺的阿爾維說。

sentences.english: The configuration of Chinese astro-geodetic net and the scale entering for adjustment as a whole.
sentences.chinese: 第一，我國天文大地網的結構和參加整體平差的規模。

sentences.english: Well, that makes sense, kind of, that Milton had clearly admired the astronomer.
sentences.chinese: 這可以說得通，彌爾頓非常崇拜這名天文學家。

definition: aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)
meteorological or astronomical phenomenon (e.g. rainbow or eclipse)
variant of 曆法|历法 calendar
